Submodules¶

scripts.barcode_filter_node module¶

The BarcodeFilterNode simply filters barcode topics by certain filters.

Actions are simple functions that return True or False depending on if the barcode fulfills or not the filter. Be careful with the ordering of the filter_actions parameter as the filters are tested in order and this may affect the outcome.

Note

This node was made to easily add new filtering functions. To make a new one simple make sure it returns a bool. Also, because of this the paramenters used can be increased. It is important that the function name and the string in the filter_actions are the same.

Sometimes the image_to_barcode_node has been seen to publish “/a” characters. Using this barcode_filter_node can help filter that type of weird publishing.

ROS Parameters:

filter_actions (list of strings): list of filter actions to be done

length filter:

min_length (int): minimum length of barcode.raw_data

max_length (int): maximum length of barcode.raw_data

contains filter:
contains_string (string): string that barcode.raw_data should have
Subscribes:
barcode (umd_msgs/Barcode): the barcode found in the image. If more than
one barcode is present, it publishes them in separate messages.
Publishes:
filtered_barcode (umd_msgs/Barcode): the same barcode as subscribed. Only publishes if all filters are passed.
class scripts.barcode_filter_node.BarcodeFilterNode[source]¶

ROS Node to filter barcode topics in different ways

contains(barcode)[source]¶

Filter function. Checks that barcode.raw_data contains the contains_string.

Parameters:barcode (umd_msgs/Barcode) – a barcode
Returns:bool. True if filter is passed.
empty(barcode)[source]¶
length(barcode)[source]¶

Filter function. Checks that the barcode.raw_data’s length is between min and max length.

Parameters:barcode (umd_msgs/Barcode) – a barcode
Returns:bool. True if filter is passed.

scripts.debugging module¶

scripts.oCam_image_node module¶

The oCamImageNode connects to an oCam camera and publishes the image feed

This node is intended to be used with an oCam camera. Currently it has only been tested with an oCam 5CRO-U found here http://withrobot.com/en/camera/ocam-5cro-u/

Sets up the camera with the provided configuration values and publishes Image messages to the topic “image”.

Note for INDEX:
Index# - (colormode, width, height, fps) 0 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 2592L, 1944L, 7) 1 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 2592L, 1944L, 3) 2 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 1920L, 1080L, 15) 3 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 1920L, 1080L, 7) 4 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 1280L, 960L, 30) 5 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 1280L, 960L, 15) 6 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 1280L, 720L, 30) 7 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 1280L, 720L, 15) 8 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 640L, 480L, 120) 9 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 640L, 480L, 90) 10 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 640L, 480L, 60) 11 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 640L, 480L, 30) 12 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 320L, 240L, 120) 13 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 320L, 240L, 90) 14 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 320L, 240L, 60) 15 - (‘YUYV 4:2:2’, 320L, 240L, 30) 16 - (‘Motion-JPEG’, 1920L, 1080L, 30) 17 - (‘Motion-JPEG’, 1920L, 1080L, 15) 18 - (‘Motion-JPEG’, 1280L, 720L, 45) 19 - (‘Motion-JPEG’, 1280L, 720L, 30) 20 - (‘Motion-JPEG’, 1280L, 720L, 15) 21 - (‘Motion-JPEG’, 640L, 480L, 30) 22 - (‘Motion-JPEG’, 640L, 480L, 15)
ROS Parameters:

saturation (int): camera saturation value [0, 8]

contrast (int): camera contrast value [0, 8]

brightness (int): camera brightness value [-4, 4]

exposure (int): camera exposure value [0, 10]

playtime (int): duration of camera feed. 0 for infinite.

cutting (float): percentage of horizontal camera cut. [0.0, 1.0]

index (int): camera resolutions & fps setting. See note above. Beware that
this can change with firmware updates (although newest is 2 years old)
camera_number (int): choose camera device, in case of more than one
oCam connected [0, n-1]
encoding (string): camera encoding to transform from CV2 to
ROS Image topic type. Options can be found here http://wiki.ros.org/cv_bridge/Tutorials/ConvertingBetweenROSImagesAndOpenCVImagesPython
Publishers:
image (sensor_msgs/Image): the output image
class scripts.oCam_image_node.oCamNode¶

ROS implementation for an oCam connection

publish()¶

Transforms from CV2 image to ROS Image and publishes topic
